## And type

And operator for types.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type And<A extends readonly unknown[]> = If<
  IsTuple<A>,
  A extends readonly [infer Current, ...infer Rest]
    ? If<
        Current,
        If<
          IsTuple<Rest>,
          And<Rest>,
          Or<[IsEmptyTypeArray<Rest>, IsTruthy<ArrayItem<Rest>>]>
        >,
        false
      >
    : A extends readonly [...infer Rest, infer Current]
    ? If<
        Current,
        If<
          IsTuple<Rest>,
          And<Rest>,
          Or<[IsEmptyTypeArray<Rest>, IsTruthy<ArrayItem<Rest>>]>
        >,
        false
      >
    : never,
  IsTruthy<ArrayItem<A>>
>
```
**References:** [If](./types-kit.if.md)<!-- -->, [IsTuple](./types-kit.istuple.md)<!-- -->, [And](./types-kit.and.md)<!-- -->, [Or](./types-kit.or.md)<!-- -->, [IsEmptyTypeArray](./types-kit.isemptytypearray.md)<!-- -->, [IsTruthy](./types-kit.istruthy.md)<!-- -->, [ArrayItem](./types-kit.arrayitem.md)

## Example


```ts
 // Expect: false
 type Foo = And<[1, 2, false]>
 // Expect: true
 type Bar = And<[true, 1, 'str']>
```
